item.title: R. Kelly: Jury selection begins in singer's sex trafficking trial
item.description: The R&B singer appears in court in New York, as potential jurors are questioned ahead of his trial.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Dragons' Den star Sara Davies joins 2021 line-up
item.description: She joins Robert Webb, John Whaite, Rhys Stevenson, AJ Odudu and others on the 2021 line-up.

item.title: British Sea Power: Indie band drop the word British from their name
item.description: The indie band say they don't wish to be confused with the "wave of crass nationalism".

item.title: Respect: Jennifer Hudson earns praise for Aretha Franklin biopic
item.description: Singer Jennifer Hudson portrays soul legend Aretha Franklin in a new film about her life.

item.title: We For India: Stars unite to help Covid relief work in India
item.description: Ed Sheeran, Annie Lennox, Mick Jagger and Bollywood actors will join forces for livestreamed event.

item.title: New 'Banksy' artwork appears at Great Yarmouth model village
item.description: A new model, apparently signed by the artist, is found at a Great Yarmouth attraction.

item.title: Peter Kay: Cancer patient 'honoured' to inspire comic's comeback gig
item.description: The comedian returned to the stage to raise money to help pay for student Laura Nuttall's treatment.

item.title: Dennis Thomas: Kool & The Gang founding member dies aged 70
item.description: He was one of the members who started the soul band that had massive hits like Celebration.

item.title: Jennifer Aniston explains cutting off unvaccinated friends
item.description: The Friends actor has elaborated on why she has "lost a few people" who have refused the jab.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Why Free Guy is more than a 'video game movie'
item.description: The Canadian actor's latest film sees him play a different kind of "naÃ¯ve and innocent" character.

item.title: Zola: How a road trip became a viral story of sex trafficking
item.description: The epic Twitter saga of a 19-year-old that attracted thousands of followers hits the big screen.

item.title: 'It just isn't sustainable' - Why touring in the EU is problematic for UK bands
item.description: One band explain what it's been like trying to tour in France in the age of Covid and Brexit.

item.title: Anything Goes: 'Olympian' efforts needed to launch London musical
item.description: The director of Anything Goes likens her cast to athletes as the Covid-defying production opens.

item.title: Jack Antonoff has redefined pop music. Here's how
item.description: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey and Lorde all rely on his advice. Now he's making a statement of his own.

item.title: Barbra Streisand: 'I've always had the right to sing what I want'
item.description: The star looks back at her career, and explains how she's always maintained creative control.

item.title: Bennifer 2.0: How Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got us talking again
item.description: How a viral photo of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck exposed the internet's lust for nostalgia.

item.title: Peter Kay charity shows: Cancer patient 'honoured'
item.description: Sometimes laughter is all you've got, says Laura Nuttall, who is receiving treatment for brain cancer.

item.title: Sir Tom Stoppard: âCancel culture has eroded free speechâ
item.description: The playwright talks to Newsnight about the impact of cancel culture and his latest production Leopoldstadt.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Capturing the perfect moment
item.description: Three sports photographers explain what goes into getting the best shots of the day at the Games.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.

item.title: Becoming Tina Turner in London's West End
item.description: Aisha Jawando takes over from Adrienne Warren in the title role in the musical Tina.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: `Wrexham - the club and the community are incredible'
item.description: Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds is âvery, very excitedâ to be co-owner of Wrexham, with the new season fast approaching.
